column17: A grenade was thrown at the HRN radio station in Tegucigalpa.
column18: 11/04/2009: On Wednesday evening, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, Honduras, assailants threw a grenade at the HRN radio station, wounding one employee and damaging the station. No group claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown, however it was suspected that the attack was carried out for political motives and political unrest.
column97: A grenade was used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused an unknown amount of damage to the HRN Radio station.
column127: \"\"One Civilian Wounded in Grenade Attack in Tegucigalpa"
column133: \"\"Homemade Bomb Hits Honduran Capital Amid Political Tension"

column17: Assailants detonated a grenade and fired upon a vehicle at the exit for El Amatillo, Lempira, Honduras.
column18: 11/04/2009: On Wednesday afternoon around 1430, at the exit for El Amatillo, Lempira, Honduras, armed assailants detonated a grenade and fired upon a vehicle transporting the mayor and deputy mayor of La Virtud, Lempira, resulting in no casualties or damage. No group claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown, however it was suspected that the attack was carried out for political motives and political unrest.
column97: A grenade and unknown firearms were used in the attack.
column127: \"\"Government Officials Targeted in Armed Attack Near El Amatillo"
column133: \"\"Political Campaigns in Middle of Crisis and Violent Attempts"

column17: An Improvised explosive device exploded in a men's restroom in Plaza Central Francisco Morazan in Tegucigalpa.
column18: 11/05/2009: On Thursday, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, Honduras, an improvised explosive device exploded in a men's restroom in Plaza Central Francisco Morazan, damaging the facility but resulting in no casualties. No group claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown, however it was suspected that the attack was carried out for political motives and political unrest.
column97: An improvised explosive device was used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused an unknown amount of damage to the Plaza Central Francisco Morazan.
column127: \"\"One Restroom Damaged in IED Attack in Tegucigalpa"
column133: \"\"Homemade Bomb Hits Honduran Capital Amid Political Tension"

column17: A grenade was thrown at the National Electricity Company's Pueblo Nuevo substation in Tegucigalpa.
column18: 11/06/2009: On Friday, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, Honduras, assailants threw a fragmentation grenade at the National Electricity Company's (ENEE) Pueblo Nuevo substation, damaging the substation but resulting in no casualties. No group claimed responsibility.
column39: The National Electricity Company's (ENEE) Pueblo Nuevo substation
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown, however it was suspected that the attack was carried out for political motives and political unrest.
column97: A fragmentation grenade was used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused an unknown amount of damage to the National Electricity Company's (ENEE) Pueblo Nuevo substation.
column127: \"\"One Power Substation Damaged in Grenade Attack in Tegucigalpa"

column17: A rocket-propelled grenade was fired at a building housing ballot boxes in the Colonia Miraflores neighborhood of Tegucigalpa.
column18: 11/12/2009: On Thursday evening, in the Colonia Miraflores neighborhood of Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, Honduras, unknown assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG-7M) at a building housing ballot boxes, resulting in no casualties or damage. The rocket was overshot and missed the target exploding 550 yards from the building. No group claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown, however it was suspected that the attack was carried out for political motives and political unrest.
column97: A rocket propelled grenade 7M, was used in the attack.
column127: \"\"Government Building Targeted in RPG Attack in Tegucigalpa"
column139: \"\"Policia Confirma que Lanzaron Granada de Fabricacion Rusa"

column17: Assailants launched grenades and fired at a vehicle in Juticalpa, Olacho, Honduras.
column18: 11/18/2009: On Wednesday, in Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras, assailants launched grenades and fired upon a vehicle owned by the leader of the opposition Liberal Party, killing two bodyguards and damaging the vehicle and several homes. No group claimed responsibility.
column39: The leader of the opposition Liberal Party
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown, however it was suspected that the attack was carried out for political motives and political unrest.
column97: Grenades and unknown firearms were used in the attack.
column108: The vehicle of the Liberal Party leader sustained an unknown amount of property damage.
column125: The summary of this incident was partially based on an article originally written in Spanish.

column17: Assailants fired grenades at buildings in Tegucigalpa, Honduras.
column18: 11/25/2009: On Wednesday evening, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, Honduras, assailants used portable launchers to fire grenades at buildings, damaging the Supreme Court and Canal 10 television buildings but resulting in no casualties. No group claimed responsibility.
column39: The Honduran Supreme Court was targeted
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown, however it was suspected that the attack was carried out for political motives and political unrest.
column97: Grenades fired from portable launchers were used in the attack.
column108: The Supreme Court and Canal 10 television buildings both sustained an unknown amount of property damage from the attack.
column128: One Television Station Damaged in Grenade Attack in Tegucigalpa

column18: 12/6/2011:  Two unidentified gunmen shot and killed Luz Marina Paz, a journalist, in Tegucigalpa, Central District, Honduras.  She was on her way to work when the assailants opened fire on her vehicle, killing her and her driver.  No group claimed responsibility.
column64: While the exact motive for this attack is unknown, it is suspected that Ms. Paz was targeted for one of two reasons.  The first, she was a small business owner and had received death threats because she refused to pay extortion money.  The second, journalists are often targeted because of what they report.  Honduras is considered a very dangerous place for journalists.
